recipes.name: Classic Cheeseburger
recipes.method: Grill the beef patty until cooked to your liking. Add salt and pepper. Melt the cheese on top. Toast the bun. Assemble the burger.

recipes.name: Garlic Butter Steak
recipes.method: Heat a skillet over high heat. Season the steak with salt and pepper. Cook the steak for 3-4 minutes on each side. Add butter and garlic to the skillet. Baste the steak with the melted butter. Rest the steak for a few minutes before slicing.

recipes.name: Pesto Pasta
recipes.method: Cook the pasta according to package instructions. Blend the basil, garlic, Parmesan cheese, and olive oil in a food processor to make the pesto sauce. Toss the pasta with the pesto sauce. Serve with extra Parmesan cheese on top.

recipes.name: Crispy Fried Chicken
recipes.method: Marinate the chicken thighs in buttermilk for at least 1 hour. Mix the flour, cornstarch, and salt in a separate bowl. Dredge the chicken in the flour mixture. Heat oil in a deep fryer or large pot. Fry the chicken for 10-12 minutes or until golden brown and crispy.

recipes.name: Mac and Cheese
recipes.method: Cook the macaroni according to package instructions. In a separate pot, melt the butter and whisk in the flour to make a roux. Gradually add the milk and whisk until the sauce thickens. Add the grated cheese and stir until melted. Combine the cheese sauce and macaroni. Bake in the oven for 20-25 minutes or until golden brown and bubbly.

recipes.name: Roasted Brussels Sprouts
recipes.method: Preheat the oven to 400°F. Cut the Brussels sprouts in half and toss with olive oil, garlic, salt, and pepper. Spread the Brussels sprouts in a single layer on a baking sheet. Roast for 20-25 minutes or until tender and caramelized.

recipes.name: Beef Wellington
recipes.method:
1. Season the beef tenderloin with salt and pepper.
2. Sear it in a hot pan until browned on all sides.
3. Let it cool in the fridge for 30 minutes.
4. Spread the mushroom mixture over the parma ham.
5. Wrap the beef in the parma ham and mushroom mixture.
6. Wrap the puff pastry around the beef, brush with egg wash and bake for 35-40 minutes.
7. Let it rest for 10 minutes before serving.

recipes.name: Roast Chicken
recipes.method:
1. Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F.
2. Rinse the chicken and pat it dry with paper towels.
3. Season the cavity of the chicken with salt and pepper.
4. Stuff the cavity with the lemon and garlic.
5. Tie the legs together with kitchen twine.
6. Spread the butter over the chicken and season with salt, pepper and thyme.
7. Roast the chicken for 1 hour and 15 minutes or until the internal temperature reaches 165 degrees F.
8. Let it rest for 10 minutes before carving.

recipes.name: Spaghetti Bolognese
recipes.method:
1. Cook the spaghetti according to the package instructions.
2. Heat the olive oil in a large pan and cook the onion, carrot and celery until softened.
3. Add the garlic and cook for another minute.
4. Add the ground beef and cook until browned.
5. Add the tomato paste and cook for 1 minute.
6. Add the canned tomatoes, red wine, bay leaves and salt and pepper.
7. Simmer for 30-40 minutes.
8. Serve the sauce over the cooked spaghetti.

recipes.name: Boeuf Bourguignon
recipes.method: Preheat the oven to 325°F. Brown the beef in a dutch oven, then add onions, garlic, mushrooms, and red wine. Cover with beef broth, then place in the oven and cook for 3-4 hours, or until the beef is tender.

recipes.name: Lobster Risotto
recipes.method: Sauté the onions and garlic in a hot skillet, then add Arborio rice and white wine. Gradually add chicken stock, stirring constantly, until the rice is cooked. Add cooked lobster meat and serve.

recipes.name: Grilled Steak
recipes.method: Preheat the grill to high heat. Rub the steaks with garlic and rosemary, then brush with olive oil and season with salt and pepper. Grill for 4-5 minutes per side, or until desired doneness is reached.

recipes.name: Baked Mac and Cheese
recipes.method:
1. Cook macaroni according to package instructions. 
2. In a separate pot, melt butter and whisk in flour to create a roux. 
3. Gradually add milk, stirring constantly, until mixture thickens. 
4. Add grated cheddar cheese and stir until melted. 
5. Mix in cooked macaroni and pour into a baking dish. 
6. Top with breadcrumbs and bake in a preheated oven at 350°F for 20-25 minutes.

recipes.name: Grilled Cheese Sandwich
recipes.method:
1. Butter one side of each bread slice. 
2. Place one slice of bread, buttered side down, in a frying pan. 
3. Add grated cheddar cheese and cover with the other bread slice, buttered side up. 
4. Cook on medium heat, flipping occasionally, until cheese is melted and bread is golden brown.

recipes.name: Beef Stroganoff
recipes.method:
1. Cook egg noodles according to package instructions. 
2. In a frying pan, sauté beef sirloin until browned. 
3. Add mushrooms and onions and cook until softened. 
4. Stir in beef broth and sour cream, and simmer until sauce thickens. 
5. Serve beef stroganoff over cooked egg noodles.

recipes.name: Roasted Chicken
recipes.method:
1. Preheat oven to 375°F. 
2. Rinse chicken and pat dry with paper towels. 
3. Rub chicken with olive oil and season with salt. 
4. Stuff cavity with garlic, rosemary, and lemon. 
5. Roast chicken in preheated oven for 1-1.5 hours, or until internal temperature reaches 165°F. 
6. Let chicken rest for 10 minutes before carving.

recipes.name: Fish Tacos
recipes.method:
1. Cut white fish into bite-sized pieces and season with salt and pepper. 
2. In a frying pan, cook fish until browned on all sides. 
3. Warm flour tortillas in a separate frying pan. 
4. Assemble tacos by placing fish, shredded cabbage, diced tomato, and chopped cilantro on each tortilla. 
5. Squeeze fresh lime juice over the top of the tacos before serving.

recipes.name: Chicken Alfredo Pasta
recipes.method:
1. Cook pasta according to package directions. Drain and set aside. 
2. In a large skillet, cook chicken over medium heat until no longer pink. Remove from pan and set aside. 
3. Add garlic to the same skillet and cook for 1-2 minutes. 
4. Add heavy cream and parmesan cheese to the skillet, stirring constantly until the cheese is melted and the sauce is heated through. 
5. Add the cooked pasta and chicken to the skillet, tossing to coat in the sauce. 
6. Serve hot, garnished with additional parmesan cheese if desired.
